page.title: 08PROPOSED SALTBY COALMINE.
page.content: The southern boundary of the Vale of Belvoir coalfield passes approximately west-east through the centre of the area. On 23 August 1978 the National Coal Board, after three years of exploration, submitted their Planning Applications to local Borough Councils. Three pits were proposed, at Asfordby, Hose and near Saltby. The proposals were fought by the local residents at a Public Enquiry on environmental grounds and the question of the need for the coal. Asfordby mine was given planning permission, Hose was refused. The N.C.B. were told to re-apply for the Saltby pit at the west end of King Lud's Entrenchments. If developed it would have an output of 2 million tonnes saleable coal per year and shafts about 750 metres deep. The mine site would cover 30 hectares, the tip (south of this area) 246 ha.
